name: TheAtlantic
text: Anita Dunn is the only person in recent years to have been in the inner circle of two winning presidential candidates—and although she's not joining the Biden White House, she's not going far, she tells @isaacdovere: https://t.co/F7tY85szFP

name: TheAtlantic
text: "As unpalatable as it sometimes may seem," @jimgolby writes, "putting U.S. troops in harm’s way isn’t always about winning or solving problems. Sometimes it’s about managing risk—keeping minor problems from turning into major crises." https://t.co/I42ZmlHMKA

name: TheAtlantic
text: Elvis Costello’s 1979 album, "Armed Forces," has been reissued at a moment when it feels more frighteningly vital and relevant than ever, @GrahamDavidA writes: https://t.co/rdeGxPelc9

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Journalists like to pretend that we know everything about a president in real time, but our information is never close to complete," @TimothyNoah1 writes: https://t.co/gQDr2xlKOc

name: TheAtlantic
text: "As soon as you sort of break your bubble, the connections can be infinite." Americans still don't have a shared definition of quarantine pods. That could be dangerous as we head into the winter, @rachgutman reports. https://t.co/AvAcS9wkBw

name: TheAtlantic
text:
.@BTS_twt are the first artists to land a Korean song at No. 1 on the Billboard Hot 100—and they did it without the help of U.S. radio.
 @lenikacruz on why the Grammy-nominated pop septet’s hit single “Life Goes On” is resonating with millions: https://t.co/nocRQHpbwZ

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @jameshamblin: I wrote a lot this year. I'm going to put some of it in a thread chronologically. Starting with ...   

1/30/20 — The U.S. doesn't have enough masks. 

https://t.co/UK0Bh8EWm7

name: TheAtlantic
text: When it comes to pandemic safety, Americans are still not on the same page. The latest Atlantic Daily, by @mimbsy: https://t.co/bOBQiCHkM3

name: TheAtlantic
text: Sign up for the newsletter here: https://t.co/ZY4adCYUKG

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @DKThomp: I wrote a roadmap to the next month of COVID-19 data

https://t.co/2yS5n4W9LS

Upshot: Everything we know about this disease, testing, and reporting suggest the official case numbers will go down, then they will go up, and up, and up.

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @prashantrao: "Chinese President Xi Jinping has markedly shifted the ideological center of gravity within the Communist Party ... All the while, a new group of scholars has been in ascendance." @changxche explains the growing chorus in Beijing for a 1930s-era doctrine https://t.co/VY6WSjKslp

name: TheAtlantic
text: Arecibo, the giant radio observatory in Puerto Rico, has collapsed. In November @marinakoren explained why one of the world's most beloved telescopes was coming to an unexpected, catastrophic end: https://t.co/gmMMgSji10

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @marinakoren: A sad day in astronomy. Arecibo has suffered still more damage—its massive instrument platform has collapsed onto its dish, according to the NSF and people in Puerto Rico. 

They knew it was coming. And this time, there’s no coming back from it: https://t.co/fSuySo6eFP

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @prashantrao: "China’s new statists have much in common with a faction that swept through Germany in the early 20th century. That affinity is no accident." Read @changxche in @TheAtlantic https://t.co/VY6WSjKslp

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @GrahamDavidA: The most timely, relevant album of the Trump era was released in 1979. https://t.co/G4O0WIeExM

name: TheAtlantic
text: A decades-old legal argument once used to justify Hitler is gaining support in Beijing. @changxche explores the links between a Nazi lawyer and China’s Communists: https://t.co/lE0vSsN85a

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @TheAtlPhoto: The 2020 Hubble Space Telescope Advent Calendar - It's that time of year again! Every day, from now until Friday, December 25, we'll be featuring a new awe-inspiring image of our universe, courtesy of NASA’s Hubble telescope. Today: The Bubble Nebula. https://t.co/oVvhgB6DAm https://t.co/khMgGAZCCU

name: TheAtlantic
text:
This week, @yayitsrob answers one of the most common questions he gets from readers: what is the best way to donate to fight climate change?
 https://t.co/vzuzykn7rF

text: RT @AdrienneLaF: "The safe assumption is that cases, hospitalizations, and deaths will all reach new highs before Christmas. The virus is simply everywhere." https://t.co/ddFMJZ2s2P

text: RT @TheAtlanticPR: 1. @Pocket's Most Read story of the year is @edyong209's cover story for @TheAtlantic's September issue, "How the Pandemic Will End."   https://t.co/Bx3OhkIcxZ

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @itscaitlinhd: Imagine being in an exclusive relationship and then realizing that you and your partner don't agree on what that actually means. Those. Are. Pods. https://t.co/6JUx5VWiw0

name: TheAtlantic
text: Looking at sparkly pictures from the Hubble space telescope might make some of us feel small—but that can be a good thing, @marinakoren writes. https://t.co/5JKml8vSGy

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The past few weeks have offered a preview of what Donald Trump’s post-presidency might look like: The president fulminates at length, playing pundit, but is a practical nonfactor in policy discussions," writes @GrahamDavidA: https://t.co/g18EwN8DSS

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @realcpaz: For four years, North Carolina has prohibited towns and cities from passing new protections for LGBTQ people. Today, that ban expires. But what comes next is uncertain, @giuliaheyward reports: https://t.co/8f8gB3UU6A

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @GrahamDavidA: Is this what the post-Trump era feels like? https://t.co/FGtWqYIbRA
